name: neg11ad
params: class c0, class c1, wff w0

stmt.origin: syl2anc(w0, wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)), wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc))

body.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))
-| wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))

body.origin: |- wi(wa(wcel(c0, cc), wcel(c1, cc)), wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))

cumulated.origin:
|- wi(w0, wb(wceq(cneg(c0), cneg(c1)), wceq(c0, c1)))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c0, cc))
-| wi(w0, wcel(c1, cc))

comment: The negatives of two complex numbers are equal iff they are equal. Deduction form of ~ neg11 . Generalization of ~ neg11d . (Contributed by David Moews, 28-Feb-2017.)
